solution_line_template: If the Franzia wine brand is three times as old as the Carlo Rosi, then the Carlo Rosi is {franzia_multiplier}*{carlo_rosi_age_q} = <<{franzia_multiplier}*{carlo_rosi_age_q}={franzia_age}>>{franzia_age} years old.

The total number of years the Carlo Rosi and the Franzia wine brands have been around is {franzia_age}+{carlo_rosi_age_q} = <<{franzia_age}+{carlo_rosi_age_q}={total_carlo_rosi_and_franzia_age}>>{total_carlo_rosi_and_franzia_age} years

The Carlo Rosi is four times older than the Twin Valley wine brand, meaning the Twin valley wine brand is {carlo_rosi_age_q}/{twin_valley_divisor} = <<{carlo_rosi_age_q}/{twin_valley_divisor}={twin_valley_age}>>{twin_valley_age} years old.

Together, the three bands have a total of {twin_valley_age}+{total_carlo_rosi_and_franzia_age} = <<{twin_valley_age}+{total_carlo_rosi_and_franzia_age}={total_age_three_brands}>>{total_age_three_brands} years of existence.
